identificationModule.briefTitle: A Safety and Efficacy Study of BCD-021 With Paclitaxel and Carboplatin Compared to Avastin With Paclitaxel and Carboplatin in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: International Multicenter Randomized Double Blind Phase III Trial Comparing Safety and Efficacy of BCD-021 (CJSC BIOCAD, Russia) and Paclitaxel + Carboplatin to Avastin® (F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd, Switzerland) and Paclitaxel + Carboplatin in Inoperable or Advanced Non-squamous Non-small-cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: BCD-021-02 is a double-blind randomized clinical trial comparing efficacy of BCD-021 (INN: bevacizumab) and paclitaxel + carboplatin to Avastin and paclitaxel + carboplatin in inoperable or advanced non-squamous NSCLC patients with pharmacokinetics substudy. The purpose of the study is to demonstrate the non-inferiority of efficacy and safety of BCD-021 compared to Avastin. Also study includes pharmacokinetics assessment.

armGroups.label: BCD-021 (CISC BIOCAD)
armGroups.description: BCD-021 is a product code for bevacizumab biosimilar manufactured by CJSC BIOCAD, Russia. In this arm patients will receive 6 courses of treatment with BCD-021 in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel. BCD-021 will be administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks (on Day 1 of each course). Paclitaxel will be administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

armGroups.label: Avastin (F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd)
armGroups.description: In this arm patients will receive 6 courses of treatment with Avastin in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel. Avastin will be administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1. Paclitaxel will be administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

interventions.name: Bevacizumab
interventions.description: Patients will receive 6 courses of bevacizumab in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel. Bevacizumab will be administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks (on Day 1 of each cycle).

interventions.name: Paclitaxel
interventions.description: Paclitaxel will be administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion on Day 1 of each 3-week course (6 courses totally)

interventions.name: Carboplatin
interventions.description: Carboplatin will be administered (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel on Day 1 of each 3-week course (6 courses totally).

primaryOutcomes.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), \>=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Area Under the Curve After the First Test Drug Administration
primaryOutcomes.description: primary outcome measure for pharmacokinetics (PK) substudy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to Day 22, after the first bevacizumab administration (time points for blood samples: 0 h 1.5 h, 3 h, 4.5 h, 6 h, 24 h, 96 h, 168 h, 336 h and 504 h)

secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary outcome measure for efficacy evaluation
secondary outcome measure for efficacy evaluation
secondary outcome measure for efficacy evaluation
secondary outcome measure for efficacy evaluation
Secondary outcome measure for immunogenicity assessment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 (before the drug administration), Day 15, 64 and 127

references.citation: Stroyakovskiy DL, Fadeeva NV, Matrosova MP, Shelepen KG, Adamchuk GA, Roy B, Nagarkar R, Kalloli M, Zhuravleva D, Voevodin GD, Shustova MS, Kryukov F. seeAlsoLinks.label: Stroyakovskiy, D.L., Fadeeva, N.V., Matrosova, M.P. et al. Randomized double-blind clinical trial comparing safety and efficacy of the biosimilar BCD-021 with reference bevacizumab. BMC Cancer 22, 129 (2022). https://doi.org/10.1186/s12885-022-09243-7

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: 343 of 353 patients received at least one dose of the study drug/comparator. 10 patients discontinued the study without receiving a single dose of the study drug/comparator. The safety analysis included all data from all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study therapy, 2 of 343 patients were excluded from the efficacy analysis due to screening failure (1 in each group), n= 341.

groups.title: Avastin (F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd)
groups.description:
In this arm patients received 6 courses of treatment with Avastin in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel.

Avastin was administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1.

Paclitaxel was administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

measures.title: Sex: Female, Male
measures.populationDescription: 2 of 343 participants were excluded from the analysis due to screening failure (1 in each group). 341 participants were analyzed (205 participants in BCD-021 group and 136 participants in Avastin group)

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Response Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), \>=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The efficacy analysis included only those patients who received at least one dose of BCD-021 or Avastin®, and in whom it was possible to assess the response to therapy.

Paclitaxel was administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Patients who received one dose of study drug and after 504 hours after injection had missed \<= 1 blood sample collection to analyze pharmacokinetics.

adverseEventsModule.description: The safety analysis included all subjects who received at least one dose of BCD-021 or Avastin® (n = 343).

eventGroups.title: BCD-021 (CISC BIOCAD)
eventGroups.description:
In this arm patients received 6 courses of treatment with BCD-021 in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel. BCD-021 was administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks (on Day 1 of each course). Paclitaxel was administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

Data on adverse events was collected from date of signing informed consent up to 18 weeks after first injection of study drug.

eventGroups.title: Avastin (F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd)
eventGroups.description:
In this arm patients received 6 courses of treatment with Avastin in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel. Avastin was administered at a dose of 15 mg/kg as 90 min intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1.

Paclitaxel was administered at a dose of 175 mg/m2 as 3 hour intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on Day 1 and carboplatin (AUC 6 mg/ml×min) as 15 - 30 min intravenous infusion just after paclitaxel every 3 weeks on Day 1.

Data on adverse events was collected from date of signing informed consent up to 18 weeks after first injection of study drug.
